sentences: Seandrea Sledge (born March 28, 1994), better known by her stage name Dreezy, is an American singer, rapper, songwriter, and actress.
Her debut album No Hard Feelings was released in 2016, followed by Big Dreez in 2019.
Life and career ==

section: == Life and career == | === 1994–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

section: == Life and career == | === 1994–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===
== Life and career == | === 1994–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Sledge was born on March 28, 1994 where she was raised on the South Side of the Chicago, Illinois.
section: == Life and career == | === 1994–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Throughout her childhood, Sledge  moved to a number of locations throughout the city of Chicago.
section: == Life and career == | === 1994–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: To escape issues that a number of teens face (blended families, constantly having new friends, and problems at home)
section: == Life and career == | === 1994–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Sledge looked into the fine arts, which helped her deal with some of the realities of her life.
section: == Life and career == | === 1994–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She explored scatting, poetry writing, and drifted towards singing at the age of 10.
section: == Life and career == | === 1994–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Sledge always felt like music was her internal escapism, and by the age of 14, she found interest in becoming a rapper.
section: == Life and career == | === 1994–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Sledge has cited rappers J. Cole and Lil Wayne as her biggest musical influences, referring to the former as her favourite rapper of all time.
section: == Life and career == | === 1994–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Sledge was putting more time into rapping, she became good friends with fellow Chicago native rapper Sasha Go Hard, and made a guest appearance on Sasha's song, "I Ain't No Hitta" in 2012.
section: == Life and career == | === 1994–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Sledge later released a song with a fellow rapper Lil Durk, called "Ghost".
section: == Life and career == | === 1994–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In February 2013, Sledge released a collaborative mixtape with fellow Chicago native rapper Mikey Dollaz, titled Business N Pleasure.
section: == Life and career == | === 1994–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In February 2014, she released her first solo mixtape, titled Schizo through AOE Music, along with a song, which features guest verse from a fellow Chicago rapper Common, called "No Good".
section: == Life and career == | === 1994–2014: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In April 2014, she released her remix of YMCMB rapper Nicki Minaj and Lil Herb's "Chiraq" and received general attention, with many fans claiming that it was better than Minaj's version.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: From Now On and No Hard Feelings ===

sentences: The remix later garnered her attention and landed her a collaboration with rapper Common on his tenth studio album Nobody's Smiling.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: From Now On and No Hard Feelings ===

sentences: In 2014 was named as the "Princess of Chicago Rap" by Noisey via Vice Magazine.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: From Now On and No Hard Feelings ===

sentences: In December 2014, it was announced that Sledge signed a recording contract with Interscope Records.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: From Now On and No Hard Feelings ===
